data.title: Kyle C. Krpata
data.text:
Kyle is recognized as a leading lawyer for Private Equity and Corporate/M&A in California by Chambers USA, where clients note he is “incredibly knowledgeable and accessible, practical and thoughtful in his approach” and “a great partner for a business" who “is incredibly responsive and cares deeply about his clients." He is recognized as a "Highly Regarded” lawyer for Mergers & Acquisitions and Private Equity by IFLR1000 and was named a 2019 “Technology Trailblazer” by The National Law Journal and a 2019 “California Trailblazer” by The Recorder. Kyle was named among the 2023 “Top 100 Lawyers” in California by the Daily Journal and is included in Lawdragon’s “500 Leading Dealmakers in America” list. He was also included among the 2021 “Top DeSPAC Lawyers in North America” by MergerLinks and recommended for M&A/Corporate and Commercial: Private Equity Buyouts by Legal 500 US.

Experience

Private Equity

Access Information Management, in its acquisition of the document storage business of Cintas and its sale to Berkshire Partners

Advent International in its investments in Thrasio Holdings, Inc.

Blackstone in:

its investment in InCloud, LLC

its investment in ISN Software Corporation

its investment in Vectra AI, Inc.

Francisco Partners in its investment in Pet Circle

Galvanize Climate Solutions in its investment in Ascend Analytics

The Gores Group in:

its sale of Elo Touch Solutions, Inc. to Crestview Partners

its sale of Cosmo Specialty Fibers, Inc. to Charlestown Investments

its sale of United Road Services to Charlesbank Capital Partners

its recapitalization and acquisition of US Farathane Corporation

the acquisition of Tepso Plastics Mex, SA de CV by US Farathan Corporation

its acquisition of Sage Automotive Interiors, Inc. from Azalea Capital, LLC

its sale of Sage Automotive Interiors to Clearlake Capital

its investment in and sale of Tiburon, Inc.

its investment in TurbineAero, Inc.

its investment in Imagine Communications Corp.

Hellman & Friedman in connection with the issuance of approximately $273 million of convertible preferred stock by its portfolio company, Associated Materials Group

Infrabridge and its portfolio company ConGlobal (f/k/a ITS ConGlobal) in its investment in Phantom Auto, Inc.

Pacific Avenue Capital Partners in its transaction to acquire the filtration business of Sogefi S.p.A.

Permira and its portfolio company Reorg Research Inc. in the acquisition of FinDox Inc.

its investment in Branch Metrics

various matters related to WeWork, Inc.

Susquehana Growth Equity in its investment in Muck Rack

TCV in:

its investment in Aviatrix Systems, Inc.

the sale of Avalor Technologies, Ltd. To Zscaler, Inc.

SPAC Transactions

Getty Images Inc. in its approximately $4.8 billion business combination with CC Neuberger Principal Holdings II, a SPAC formed by a partnership of CC Capital and Neuberger Berman

Gores Guggenheim, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by affiliates of The Gores Group and Guggenheim Capital, in its $20 billion business combination with Polestar Performance AB

Gores Holdings, a SPAC sponsored by an affiliate of The Gores Group, in its business combination with Hostess Brands, with an initial enterprise value of approximately $2.3 billion

Gores Holdings II, a SPAC sponsored by an affiliate of The Gores Group, in its business combination with Verra Mobility, with an initial enterprise value of approximately $2.4 billion

Gores Holdings III, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by an affiliate of The Gores Group, in its $1.55 billion business combination with Pacific Architects and Engineers, Inc. (PAE) (a portfolio company of Platinum Equity)

Gores Holdings IV, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by an affiliate of The Gores Group, in its business combination with United Wholesale Mortgage, LLC (UWM), in a transaction that values UWM at approximately $16.1 billion

Gores Holdings V, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by The Gores Group, in its $8.5 billion business combination with Ardagh Metal Packaging S.A.

Gores Holdings VI, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by The Gores Group, in its $2.9 billion business combination with Matterport, Inc.

Gores Holdings VIII, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by The Gores Group, in its pending approximately $1.6 billion business combination with Footprint International Holdco, Inc.

Gores Metropoulos, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by affiliates of The Gores Group and Metropoulos & Co., in its $3.4 billion merger with Luminar Technologies, Inc.

Gores Metropoulos II, Inc., a SPAC sponsored by Gores Metropoulos Sponsor II LLC (an affiliate of The Gores Group and Dean Metropoulos), in its $1.925 billion business combination with Sonder Holdings

TCV, as an investor in Payoneer Inc., in Payoneer’s $3.3 billion business combination with FTAC Olympus Acquisition Corp., a SPAC focused on technology and financial services technology companies

ABD Insurance and Financial Services, Inc. in its $1.35 billion merger with Newfront Insurance, Inc.

Alibaba in various transactions

Anvita Health in its sale to Humana

Chewy in its sale to PetSmart

J.Crew Group in certain investments
